content: Nirnimesh Ghose: Home Page < School of Computing University of Nebraska - Lincoln Office: 107 Schorr Center, 1100 T St, Lincoln, Nebraska 68588-0150. Phone: (402) 472-5074 Fax: (402) 472-7767 Email: nghose@unl.edu Nirnimesh Ghose I am a tenure-track assistant professor with the School of Computing at University of Nebraska, Lincoln. I received my Ph.D. in the Electrical and Computer Engineering from the University of Arizona, Tucson, in 2019 under the guidance of Prof. Loukas Lazos and Prof. Ming Li (unofficial advisor). I received my M.S. in Electrical Engineering from the Illinois Institute of Technology in 2012. I obtained my B.Tech. degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Babu Banarasi Das National Institute of Technology & Management affiliated to the Uttar Pradesh Technical University, Lucknow, India in 2010. My research focuses on network security and privacy with applications to emerging wireless networks, cyber-physical systems, Internet-of-things, aviation and transportation networks, bio-social inspired dynamic spectrum access and the interaction between cybersecurity and social networks. I am seeking self-motivated graduate students to work in my Security of Wireless & Ad hoc Networks (SWAN) Lab. If you are interested in fields related to my area of research, please send your resume, GRE scores, and TOEFL scores (if applicable).
